channel.title: Programming Ideas
channel.description:
[size=15pt][b][u][i]If you do not have a programming idea, DO NOT POST! I don't wanna hear what you have to think about my programming skills.[/i][/u][/b][/size]
I would like to take on a programming project, but I can't think of anything to write. I am not the best programmer in the world, only knowing Java and Pascal/Delphi for the most part, but I can find stuff out if I need to know how to do it. If anybody has an idea for a program to write or a site that might be able to help me, please tell.

item.title: Programming Ideas
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

If you lack creativity you will fail as a programmer.

That’s why I didn’t take it any further, I knew Java pretty damn well but I just had a severe lack of creativity when it came to making programs.

If you can’t find inspiration in your own computing habits then it’s unlikely you will succeed.

Read full topic

item.title: Programming Ideas
item.dc:creator: @Original_Daniel Original Daniel
item.description:
@Original_Daniel wrote:

rscheater13:

I’m not as good when it comes to graphics, but I will try. I have thought about making a game before, but like I said, I have no creativity and couldn’t think of a decent game to write.

You don’t need to be a good at graphics to make a basic game. One of the first programs I wrote was scissors paper rock. The only graphics were pictures of a rock/paper scissors to click on and to show which was chosen by each player.

Read full topic

[Some] people gave you great advice and you just shot it down and whined about it.

item.title: Programming Ideas
item.dc:creator: @rscheater13 rscheater13
item.description:
@rscheater13 wrote:

Most of you guys have the maturity, and common sense level, of a fucking goat. I said that I wasn’t that good so I didn’t sound cocky you prick.

Tree:

This guy is a bloody moron. He knows barely anything, yet tries act condescending towards the individuals who do know what they are doing.

If you think you are perfect, then I’m not going to correct you on your grammar because I don’t know what I’m talking about. If anybody knew what they were doing, the would post an actual good idea. Although I do like R.I.P RSC’s idea to make a program to solve puzzles. And the reason I asked for a program idea is because I have 0 creativity.

Original Daniel:

Before you can make anything useful you have to expand your skills. Make a basic game or something like a cryptogram.

I’m not as good when it comes to graphics, but I will try. I have thought about making a game before, but like I said, I have no creativity and couldn’t think of a decent game to write.

Read full topic

item.title: Programming Ideas
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

i didn’t judge you; you judged yourself. if you actually felt you were competent enough in your skills, you wouldn’t have mentioned your level at all. you want a project to work on that will be useful for yourself and others, but you want someone else to give you the idea? if you hadn’t missed my main point, you would have realized this isn’t the best approach.

My knowledge is plenty to start my own projects. Do not underestimate me.

then either you’re too lazy to come up with your own idea for a project or you’re underestimating yourself. it’s really not that hard: find something that annoys you and write software to fix it. it actually makes sense, if you think about it.

Read full topic

item.title: Programming Ideas
item.dc:creator: @rscheater13 rscheater13
item.description:
@rscheater13 wrote:

Again, you are judging me based on what I said. And ignoring that I also said I can find something out if I need to. I’m wanting to expand my knowledge by making a program. And most likely, either Pascal/Delphi or Java is capable.
I have taking a programming class in Java. It took 2 semesters so I am familiar with the commands and techniques used.
And I never said learning another programming language was a bad thing, but I don’t really need to. I doubt I will have to write a program in one language and it have to run another program in a different language.
My knowledge is plenty to start my own projects. Do not underestimate me.

Read full topic

item.title: Programming Ideas
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

i think yakman has a point, rscheater13… perhaps it would be better if you expanded your knowledge before jumping into a project, which is what i think he was trying to suggest (and, therefore, was actually proposing an idea). there is a lot more to programming than languages, so try to expand horizontally by learning other branches, such as: algorithms, methodologies, and target systems and architectures. and who’s to say learning a new language is a bad thing? there are a couple ones out there that are drastically different from the most commonly used (one example is PROLOG, which is quite interesting if you ever take a look at it).

the idea is that when you expand your knowledge you get an idea of what things you like and want to pursue in the future, which eventually leads to starting your own projects

Read full topic

item.description:
@rscheater13 wrote:

The only thing failed is your comment. Don’t post if you don’t have anything to say pertaining to what I’m asking.
Their is no call for what you said. Since most of the posts were a waste of my time, then this whole board has failed.
And the only person that is “a fuckin idiot” is a person that spams another thread with bullshit. Such as your post.

item.title: Programming Ideas
item.dc:creator: @rscheater13 rscheater13
item.description:
@rscheater13 wrote:

[quote=“yakman, post:10, topic:237119”]so let me guess this straight,

you admit you’re a bad programmer, but you want to make something useful…
normally, to make something useful you have to be a good programmer[/quote]
That is why I said:

rscheater13:

…but I can find stuff out if I need to know how to do it…

Please don’t post if you don’t have an idea and are going to criticize what I say. I have no idea how good or bad of a programmer you are and I don’t really care, but I wouldn’t criticize you based on what you say. For all you know, I might be a better programmer than you. Please don’t judge me, you don’t know me.

Frell:

Auto Typer, like what frank said.

An auto-typer isn’t much of a challenge. And since the GE came out in RS, their isn’t really a need for them. I don’t play any other online games so I wouldn’t know any that would need one. And I wouldn’t play a game just to make an auto-typer for anybody that gets the smart idea to suggest one.

Read full topic

item.title: Programming Ideas
item.dc:creator: @rscheater13 rscheater13
item.description:
@rscheater13 wrote:

yakman:

write a brainfuck interpreter

“The brainfuck language is an esoteric programming language noted for its extreme minimalism. It was designed to challenge and amuse programmers, and is not suitable for practical use.”
That is the first 2 lines from the wiki link.

frank_:

write something to automate a task for you

Such as make a bunch of periods? I have nothing that I do repetitively enough to write a program for, especially to release for others. And anything that I could think of would be done when the computer is started or would have to be done when the program is ran, which may cause something to happen that the user doesn’t want.

I’m sorry if it seems like I’m shooting all the ideas down, but I want a serious idea. I want something actually useful, that doesn’t involve me learning another language preferably.

Read full topic
